scene.matchingInstructions: Match the items on the left to the correct areas on the right.

matches.match: Government owns major industries, such as oil and gas.
Teens can decide whether to work or go to college.
The total hours a person can work is regulated.
The government allows free trade with all other nations.
Prices are not regulated and can increase quickly.
Labor laws make it difficult to fire employees.
Government sets the prices on many essential goods.
Some people earn huge salaries, while others earn little.
Government provides free housing and health care.

scene.instructions: When you are done, check your results by clicking 'Check Answers.'

multiple.question: Which of the following would NOT be true of a market economy?

answers.answer: Consumers choose which products to buy.
Prices are flexible and subject to change.
People have very different income levels.

multiple.question: In which way is the United States like a command economy?

answers.answer: The government owns all of the resources.
Consumers are free to buy or not buy products.
Prices on essential items are controlled.
The government sets a minimum wage and age requirements for workers.
The government protects private property rights.

multiple.question: Which of these countries has the strongest market economy?
What motivates people to work in a market economy?

answers.answer: satisfaction at a job well done

multiple.question: What often happens in a command economy when government planners set prices?

answers.answer: Consumers receive equal shares of goods.
